hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#Set the below parameters manually package_name="python3" published_version="3.6.4"
#Check distro and available version in repo : rhel7.x, Sles11.x/12.x, Ub16.x/17.x . /etc/os-release if [ $ID == "rhel" ]; then available_version=$(sudo yum info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "sles" ]; then available_version=$(sudo zypper info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "ubuntu" ]; then available_version=$(sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-cache policy $package_name | grep Candidate | head -1 | cut -d ' ' -f 4) fi
if [[ $available_version == *"$published_version"* ]]; then echo "Version $published_version is already available in repo" echo "Exact name: $available_version ... Failing" exit 1 else echo "Published version is not available in repo. Going ahead." fi #------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install -y gcc g++ make libncurses5-dev libreadline6-dev libssl-dev libgdbm-dev libc6-dev libsqlite3-dev libbz2-dev xz-utils patch wget tar
wget https://www.python.org/ftp/python/3.6.4/Python-3.6.4.tar.xz tar -xvf Python-3.6.4.tar.xz cd Python-3.6.4 ./configure --prefix=/usr/local --exec-prefix=/usr/local make sudo make install
make test python_version=$(python3 --version 2>&1)
echo $python_version > output.txt
echo 'Python 3.6.4' > expected.txt result=`diff output.txt expected.txt`
if [ -z "$result" ] ; then exit 0 else exit 1 fi
